intro.description: Welcome to the Stardust Cheat Sheet. This cheat sheet guides you through the basic steps of building a workflow model with a process definition and its elements in the Stardust Developer Modeling Perspective.

item.title: Open the Stardust Developer Modeling Perspective
item.description:
If the Stardust Developer Perspective is not already opened:
1. Select Window > Open Perspective > Other...
2. In the following dialog, select the Stardust Development Perspective.
3. OK the dialog.
This step changes the perspective to set up the workbench for Stardust modeling.

item.title: Create a New Process Model
item.description:
1. Select File > New > Stardust Process Model.
2. In the following dialog, enter the id, the name and optionally the description of the model.
3. If not already set, a dialog opens where you have to browse to the location of your carnot.license file.

item.title: Create a Process Definition
item.description:
. In the Outline view of the Process Workbench Modeler right-click your model.
. From the pop-up menu, select New Process Definition.
. Open the properties page of the new process with a double-click to set properties like id and name.
The new process definition appears in the Outline view and its default diagram will be opened automatically. With a double-click you open a diagram explicitly.

item.title: Add an Activity
item.description:
1. In the diagrams toolbar palette select Activities (expand Items).
2. Choose the activity type.
3. Place the activity box on the diagram canvas.
4. Double-click the symbol to open the properties dialog to set the activity's properties.

item.title: Adding an Application
item.description:
1. In the diagrams toolbar palette select Applications or Int. Applications respectively.
2. Choose the application type.
3. Place the application box on the diagram canvas.
4. Double-click to open the application's properties dialog to set name, id and type-specific properties.

item.title: Creating Data
item.description:
1. In the diagram toolbar palette select Data.
2. Choose the data type.
3. Place the data symbol on the diagram canvas.
4. Open the diagram's properties dialog with a double-click to set name, id and type-specific properties.

item.title: Specifying Data Mappings
item.description:
Proceed with setting an In data mapping from the data element to the activity:
1. In the diagram toolbar palette select Connect.
2. Click on the data symbol.
3. Click on the activity symbol.
To create an Out data mapping click the activity symbol first and the data symbol second.

item.title: Creating a Transition between Activities
item.description:
1. Create a second activity to create the connection to.
2. In the diagram toolbar palette, select Connect.
3. Click on the predecessor activity.
4. Click the subsequent activity.
